div.label: R or r
div.p: , a liquid conſonant, being the 17th letter of R, our alphabet. Its found is formed by a guttural extruſion of the breath vibrated through the mouth, with a fort of quivering motion of the tongue drawn from the teeth, and canulated with the tip a little elevated towards the palate. In Greek words it is frequently aſpirated with an h after it, as in rhapſody, rhetoric, &c. otherwiſe it is always followed by a vowel at the beginning of words and ſyllables.

In the notes of the ancients, R. or RO. ſigniſies Roma ; R. C. Romana civitas ; R. G. C. rei gerenda cauf a ; R. F. E. D. recte factum et dictum ; R. G. F. regis filius ; R. P. res publica, or Romani principes ; and R. R. R. F. F. F. res Romana ruet ferro ſame, flamma.
Uſed as a numeral, R anciently ſtood for So ; and with a daſh over it, thus R, for 80,000; but the Greek
r, p, with a ſmall mark over it, ſignified 100; with the fame mark under it, it denoted 1000 X 100 ; thus p
ſignified 100,000. In the Hebrew numeration n denoted 200 : and with two horizontal points over it 1000 X 200 ; thus n = 200,000.
In the preſcriptions of phyſcians, R or R ſtands for recipe, i, e. “ take."
